Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the original source of the 44% figure is not provided and the advocacy group did not respond to an inquiry about the source.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as the data used in the report is old, collected in 1996, making it almost 18 years old.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that work should be an escape from poverty, which may not always be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the 44% figure, such as the nature of the work being low-paying or unstable, which may contribute to homelessness despite employment.
